page.title: 11ARABLE FARMING IN ALKHAM
page.content: The lie of the land is a great influence on land-use, the result being that almost all the farms have mixed agriculture. Flatter land is most suited for the operation of modern farm machinery and arable farming is concentrated in these areas.Hedges have been grubbed out to make fields larger, some reaching 70 acres.Crops grown include wheat, barley, rape, oats and field peas. Wheat harvested in July is sold to millers, barley planted in winter or spring is sold for malting or animal feed.Rape which gives such colour to the valley in May is harvested in July and the seed sold to vegetable oil producers and cattle feed manufacturers.Most oats and peas are used on the farm for cattle and sheep feed during the winter months.
